column4: I run that Ubuntu screen program, but inside such a session I started another screen session. When I press C-a C-d, it detaches from the outer Ubuntu screen session. How do I detach from the inner screen session?
I will kill the second session with ctrl+d
that has no effect.
if you are in the second session? you should be able to ctrl+d and exit
I also cannot press F9 to get the menu.
my second session is this irc chat.
there is no extra shell
that doesn't sound like a very informed solution.
if you kill the first session, I think it will kill the second session
Im just saying what is easy
I already found the answer.
screen -r?
great? i use screen everyday, i hate it when that happens [:
no, and you should t advice people to kill programs.
solution was c-a-a-d.
ah I didnt know you were running the program...
yes, you knew.
because I said it was my irc client.
ctrl+d is the easy thing to do, if you do not like the advice, feel free to ask someone else.
I also told you that ctrl+d didnt work.
and where was I?
you should really stop your redundant talking.
I didnt know you were in your irc client.
you got your answer /ignore fasta
